Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Lactomodulin (natural AMPs; class 2b bacteriocins; Gram-positive bacteria, prokaryotes, UCLL1)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (36.21%) toPx-MorL=G=A: 12%.Activity: active against S. aureus ATCC 25923 or MRSA BAA 2313(MIC 0.8-1.4 uM), C. difficile ATCC 43602 (MIC 1.1 uM), L. monocytogenes ATCC 15313 (MIC 1.2 uM), E. faecium anti-VRE BAA 2317 (MIC 1.2 uM), E. coli ATCC 33694 (MIC 7.5 uM), P.aeruginosa BAA 1744 (NA), and S.enterica ATCC 13314 (NA). NA: not observed.Also showed anti-inflammatory activity.
Literature Information.Author: Mousa WK, Ghemrawi R, Abu-Izneid T, Ramadan A, Al-Marzooq F. 2023
Literature Information.Reference: Int J Mol Sci. 2023 Apr 7;24(8):6901. doi: 10.3390/ijms24086901.PubMed
Literature Information.Title: Discovery of Lactomodulin, a Unique Microbiome-Derived Peptide That Exhibits Dual Anti-Inflammatory and Antimicrobial Activity against Multidrug-Resistant Pathogens.
